model

Interface PongModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyPongModel

    public interface PongModel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void compute(java.util.Set<model.Input> input, long delta_t)
      Takes the inputs and applies them to the model, computing one simulation step. delta_t is the time that has passed since the last compute step -- use this in your time integration to have the items move at the same speed, regardless of the framerate.
      java.awt.Point getBallPos() 
      int getBarHeight(model.BarKey k) 
      int getBarPos(model.BarKey k)
      getters that take a BarKey LEFT or RIGHT and return positions of the various items on the board
      java.awt.Dimension getFieldSize()
      a valid implementation of the model will keep the field size will remain constant forever.
      java.lang.String getMessage()
      Will output information about the state of the game to be displayed to the players
      java.lang.String getScore(model.BarKey k)
      getter for the scores.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        void compute(java.util.Set<model.Input> input,
             long delta_t)
        Takes the inputs and applies them to the model, computing one simulation step. delta_t is the time that has passed since the last compute step -- use this in your time integration to have the items move at the same speed, regardless of the framerate.

      • getBarPos

        int getBarPos(model.BarKey k)
        getters that take a BarKey LEFT or RIGHT and return positions of the various items on the board

      • getBarHeight

        int getBarHeight(model.BarKey k)

      • getBallPos

        java.awt.Point getBallPos()

      • getMessage

        java.lang.String getMessage()
        Will output information about the state of the game to be displayed to the players

      • getScore

        java.lang.String getScore(model.BarKey k)
        getter for the scores.

      • getFieldSize

        java.awt.Dimension getFieldSize()
        a valid implementation of the model will keep the field size will remain constant forever.
